comments.body: The reason the old Mojang logo is called "thing" is because if you translate it into English you get thing
A tip if you want to delete them faster: go to %appdata%, then the .minecraft folder, then the saves folder. You can select and delete all the worlds you want at once from there.
Thanks for the tip! I tried it and it has helped me out a lot.
i have a lot of worlds and i want to delete them
Hi

Yeah. I have over 250 worlds from about 7 years ago, and I‚Äôm trying to figure out how to delete it. Takes up lots of space, and I can‚Äôt even take pictures anymore. And your very right, as it is very tedious and takes up lots of time. I only deleted 10 worlds in the span of 5 minutes or so. Pretty long process, and I‚Äôd like a select feature because I have some ‚Äúsentimental‚Äù worlds.
I have 831 worlds and I‚Äôm on bedrock‚Ä¶ WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO BRO
This is easy to code and will help a lot of players.
Would be easy to add trough a resourcepack
Great great idea!
Would be useful for learning the language
„ÅÇ
Pretty please! Whenever I try to play bedrock the movement within the crafting interface is nigh nauseating. Even just putting it in as an accessibility option would be wonderful!
Disabling the "screen animations" option should disable this too. No idea why it doesn't
It should definitely be added back!
Maybe it can be brought back, just ask (politely) for it in Minecraft translation project in Crowdin
OH, and the best one: "FOV: Friday Night Footy"
Bring it back as an Aussie I am very disappointed that this was removed.

Perhaps the more formal one could stay as is, Australian English, and "Aussie Slang" could be the return of those translations? Would be really cool to see it return, maybe with some new references alongside the old, like Zombies could be Mokoi maybe
Why does Mojang do this with Java only? I am really annoyed by this as well...

Personally i play minecraft on the xbox one and cave sounds are annoyingly scary and i think this is a great idea for a slider in the audio settings because all audio settings we have are music and sound and thats it

For some reason the bug tracker ticket for this was resolved as working as intended, so Mojang has confirmed that this intrusive narrator behaviour is something they've intentionally programmed into the game, for some reason.

Would definitely like to see it being made rebindable, since it makes life especially difficult in these cases.

I was just in the middle of making yet another post about this annoying issue when in the middle of it, all my writing just disappears.

I agree with you to add an option to change the keybind as "ctrl" is obviously my sprint key so I use it a lot and "b" is my optifine zoom key which for no reason turns on the narrator. I'm sick of it. why did mojang just make it like, its not that blind people who rely on their ears are going to be playing minecraft anyway so they might as well just remove it.
I love this! This is exactly how I'd like it to function and for the same reason.
This is useful if you need to change which Network you are connected to, or change LAN settings, without restarting the world. Close LAN should definitely be added to Minecraft.
yesss i need it so
It would also be useful to know if crashes reported by my game were being prioritized as bug-fixes so I know if I should separately report crashes or other issues I'm experiencing.
On Windows, you can see the crash reports, but they do not have much detail to the client, only to Mojang.
i need this so much
It exists but is too hidden
Bagus
I know it would be fun but it would be incompatible. And it would only work for certain mice. MB4 and MB5 are compatible on most new games though.
Some Bedrock players don't even know what the Java edition is, and therefore have no Mojang account, so this would not work.
Why can't Xbox be like other companies in the sense that other people can have the same username, just with a string of numbers being them, like Blizzard?
All Java Accounts are linked to Microsoft so they could get easily get Bedrock players to link their Mojang account or if they don't have one; create one.
That whould be nice üëå üòå

I think this is actually worse than how it was before because it doesnt directly show the name of the world you want to join and "friend of friend" option basically has no meaning now. can we revert this one back - or at least change it so we can see name of the multiplayer worlds now?

I want to make some suggestions. Compared with json UI and Ore UI, Ore UI has too few functions. First of all, Ore UI does not display the friend's archive name and friend's version number, which brings trouble to players. The player doesn't know what the friend's version number is. If there is a version difference, friends can't surf the Internet. I want to add Ore UI's suggestion about displaying friends' version numbers. The second point is that Ore UI does not display the name of your friend's archive. Imagine that you can't see your friend's file name when playing, and you can't judge what he is playing, which will also bring some trouble, so please ask the developer to add and display his friend's file name. Thirdly, the color coding support for the "¬ß"character is added in Ore UI, which leads to few default colors in Ore UI. I wish I could add this function back.
You should be able to add an invitation option on this page. You can see who invited you, and you can refuse or join the game.

It looks terrible, the main menu looks even more cluttered and ugly than it did before.
Please move it to the bottom, perhaps alongside the profile button.

This change rather discourages playing with friends.
The Realms feature is paid for and only some players use it, and I feel that the old friends tab was by far the easiest to use.
I think it would be good to separate it from Realms, so why not increase the tabs to four and have a friends tab?
With a solid name and number of players displayed as well.

I prefer the multiplayer world list as it used to be.
So for me this ‚Äúfriend drawer‚Äù is the worst.

There is a ‚Äújoin‚Äù button next to a friend's name, but you can't see who is hosting the world you are joining, the world name, or how many people are joining.

If the friend drawer doesn't solve that problem, they should add the multiplayer world list as a separate screen.

The ‚Äúfriend drawer‚Äù idea is great, but there must be more improvements to be made. Please consider this.

Hi, I am translating at deepl, so I apologize if there are any funny points.
The new UI friend view is very confusing to use and a new friend tab needs to be added in addition to world, realms and servers.
I would like the new friend tab to show the world name, version and number of participants.

The friend‚Äôs drawer should be removed from the Title Screen/Main Menu. If not removed, then its location should be adjusted.

It not only clutters up the Title Screen, but it also breaks the established UX design pattern where all buttons and options appear under the Minecraft logo. This change also causes issues with splash text being incorrectly aligned on the logo which breaks parity with Java.
change it back please, its very useful and important seeing the version, player count, and world name.

Please stop trying to make it easier, it only makes it more difficult to diagnose issues and actually join people. The old UI was buggy, difficult, and nontransparent, and this is somehow worse. It fails to be easy to use or easy to understand, it's only easy to look at.

How can I transfer worlds built on one phone to another phone in order to continue building the world's on the later phone?
Txs
This is already possible
I found that the app does not allow audio recordings by other apps please let them allow internal audio recording
pls tell me howüôÇüôÇüôèüèªüôèüèªüôèüèª
That's really bad that i can't make content because it's impossible to record audio i wish they could add this feature üòî
Please tell me how ü§î
Maybe add a slider to the game's options? This way, players who like to see their surroundings can still do so.

One more thing to add: This was a feature that was available in console editions of Minecraft before Bedrock took over. I also personally think that this would be a cool feature to add for us console veterans. It would also be cool if this feature was available in both Java edition and Bedrock.
FOV isn't the right term for the camera, but bringing this back Bedrock and adding it to Java would be nice.
I'm heavily in favour for this idea. The reason is that, if every item is called "groot" and it means we can still play the game, it shows that we're real pros! üòé
This sounds AWESOME Wait i m-mean.... I am Groot.
imagine building with any of the gray blocks but I am in favor of this idea
Yas!! ‚ô°

As a Marvel fan, I love this. I don't see why they can't add it. They already have "Pirate Speak" and "LOLCAT". If they can't use the name Groot, it would be cool if they used something similar to it.
I am Groot. (Means: Awesome idea! It wouldn't be hard to do either!)
And add the Galactic Alphabet (A.K.A. The Minecraft Enchanting Table Language)to that as well.
"________ died a sweet death"
I‚Äôm glad I‚Äôm not the only one who noticed this. Considering the amount of times I‚Äôve died via berries, as have many others, I think a death message for this would be great.
Gacha
Among SwiftKey Flow
I mean Microsoft right‚úå‚úå‚úå

I find it hard to understand how Microsoft can be associated with Minecraft, yet I can't use an Xbox controller to play Java edition on my PC.  How is it possible that Minecraft does not support the controller from a PC???? This is beyond ridiculous.  If I could play Java edition on the Xbox...I would.  But I can't do that either.  How hard can it possibly be to set up Java edition to work with an Xbox controller on a PC????  Infuriating.
I get your feeling.
Very ridiculous they don‚Äôt already have it

i completely agree!! i was trying to do this earlier as i prefer playing on a controller in comparison to keyboard. I find it bizarre that a two things in relation to Microsoft do not work in harmony. AND THIS FIRST POST WAS OVER 2 AND A HALF YEARS AGO 

I was trying to find a way to solve this but there is NOTHING in relation to microsoft about using a controller.

There's a way to do this via steam, but nothing here :(
Are you talking about the legacy console VERSION, or the Minecraft bedrock FOR consoles?

Just type a chat that says:

/cb

It will give you 64 command blocks.
if your gonna do that add it to all the versions... add the command blocks to the creative inventory IF your OP
Bilbo baggins PS4 still doesn‚Äôt have command blocks they could be on there
That would be great be great if I could have it in my inventory I love Minecraft I am 7 and my mum is typing this

I think its that way so no one accidentally destroys anything using it same with structure blocks, however I wish there was some type of command that you could enter that would  show them in the creative menu.
YES. please change this. I too very much dislike it, and I know of other people do as well. I found the old layout to be much easier and quicker to navigate and overall, just much better.
I logged back on after only a few days and saw the change. And worlds are hidden that I don't have access to bc packs I no longer have instead of being locked. It's so dumb

Please for the love of god change this back or at least make it a option in the settings because every device i try to play on are now crashing from the layout and now I'm thinking about giving up and just quitting the game entirely.
Don‚Äôt know if this update caused it, but all of a sudden all my global resources have been deleted and won‚Äôt let me even repurchase. So if this update made that glitch, it‚Äôs not a good one. :-(
Isso ser√° muito √∫til na minha opini√£o.

It is so laggy. Aside from that, it is somewhat difficult to navigate, but I could get used to that. I do like the overall design. However, I always turn on immediate respawn and the coordinates. Can you make personalized options so if we want something always on or always off, it will be? Also, please add a search menu for texture packs/mods, because this is very difficult to navigate. I desperately need a second jump button above the joystick, and maybe that could be optional. I would also like an option to add 3D item physics to the game. Overall, I'm impressed with the new design, but it does need some work. üòÄüëç

It's always the constant topic of inventory issues for survival either in carrying, filtering, and sorting, oddly it's never really taken up as a focus for the devs, even though its very common for datapacks and mods.

I agree 10000% with this. I rarely play bedrock because having to manually sort the inventory is so tediously painful. I always use the mouse wheelie mod or inventory tweaks mod in java edition. It should be built in. Even other games similar to Minecraft have the function to sort inventory and that creates a much more engaging and blissful gaming experience. I really hope that the developers work on an inventory sorting function like the mods I mentioned. I'd definitely play more if they did.
